Description: Limestone shabti of the god's servant of Amun of the abebet shrine (?), Raemheb, with painted and incised detail: a black and white striated lappet-wig, a modelled face with traced eyes, a black and red collar and crossed arms in relief with bracelets holding two red hoes; the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in seven rows of incised black hieroglyphs separated with red lines; the back of one arm is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
